title: What upcoming technology do you think will be the most life changing? - Quora

response.answer_text: #1 Solar Roads If they can work through some legitimate issues, solar roads could have a massive impact on society as we know it.  Companies like http://www.solarroadways.com have been working on the concept for awhile now. The concept is roadways are essentially massive solar panels and conduit. No more running wires underground or above ground. Imagine possibilities like: Plug into the road Phone died? Plug it into the road. Need power for… anything? Plug it into the nearest road. Mesh Network of Electricity Like a mesh wifi network at home, a road would act as “backbone” to carry electricity across large distances. Wireless electricity (yes, another innovation in R&D) access points could transmit electricity from primary roads to endpoints. Heck, this could be used to lay new internet infrastructure too. Even with wifi, air still causes slowdowns in network traffic. Now real traffic could be used to help with that. Self-powered cars So we’ve seen how you can lay a phone on a pad to charge it. Imagine an electric car that can charge itself just by touching the road. Think of the implications this would have on the oil and gas business (which is increasingly turning into “energy” companies). Imagine tax dollars being used for “road and fuel” infrastructure. I wouldn’t mind paying taxes as much if I didn’t have to pay for gas. Better roadways A self powered road with heaters could prevent icing in colder climates. These roads can have LED lights in them. Imagine not having painted lines fade away. It’d also be easier to setup detours, identify problems for drivers before you get there (like turning the road red as a warning), etc. Is an emergency vehicle coming through? Turn the road to an emergency color and print instructions right on the road. In a driverless society, roads would really act more like a track, and you’d always know where you are. Oh, and “upgrading” the road could be as simple as a software update. When a road is damaged, it would be known immediately if a monitor detects a problem. Better parking lots Need to reconfigure your spaces? Just reset the layout instead of repainting lines. Off Grid Living Even if there aren’t roads, an off-grid house with a solar driveway could potentially provide sufficient power for a home. I wouldn’t mind not paying an electric bill. There’s more to off-grid living than just power, but it’s a major hurdle that could potentially be bypassed. This could, conceivably, make more remote/affordable land more practical for development. This could have positive implications on creating sustainable and affordable housing that doesn’t suck. #2 Glass Advancements in glass could have a major impact as well. Those solar roadways? Made possible by a stronger glass. Beyond that, Corning put out a video with a vision for the future with glass. It does a better job of explaining than I could.  — There are lots of problems with these technologies, but human kind tends to be pretty resilient and resourceful. Maybe we’ll see some of these someday in the near-ish future. If so, they’ll change life pretty substantially.

Transportation as a service via self driving cars. It means most people (excepting hobby-racers and tradesmen) won’t need to own cars the way they do now. The obvious benefits for most people: no insurance, no car payments, no driving headache, able to use drive time for other things. The obvious benefits are going to be secondary to the mostly invisible secondary benefits of urban land reuse. With this change we’ll need only 10–20% of the cars we currently have on the road. This means that across the US hundreds of millions of parking spaces will free up. Half of many urban areas is parking. Don’t believe me? go to google maps and look at a business park or a shopping mall…check out the size of the building compared to the size of the parking. Three things have become more expensive over the past 40 years: housing, medical care, and education. This will help solve the first, and if we’re smart we can solve some of the third with this.
A I , I find it worrisome. There is something very sinister and threatening about it. With A I and drones and self driving vehicles will we eventually make people a small , rare part of society.
